title: Add
summary: Adds a numerical value to a container.

parameters.description: A numerical expression to be added to the container.
A container to which the value should be added.

title: Ask
summary: Displays a dialog box with an editable text field containing the provided value.
description: When no `default-value` is provided, the `empty` string is assumed. The HyperTalk script stops executing until a user has made a choice. The text entered by the user will be put into the the `it` variable.

parameters.description: A prompt string to display in the dialog.
The default text to be displayed in the edit field.

title: Answer
summary: Displays a dialog box with up to three user-selectable buttons.
description:
When no button names are provided, `OK` and `Cancel` will be assumed by default.

The HyperTalk script stops executing until a user has made a choice. The name of the button chosen by the user will be put into the the `it` variable.

parameters.description: The prompt string to display in the dialog.
The name of the first (default) button.
The name of the second button.
The name of the third button.
The number of times to beep.

examples.description: Beep once for every button on the card layer.
examples.code: beep the number of card buttons

title: Choose Tool
summary: Chooses the specified tool from the tool palette.
description: Acceptable tool names and their corresponding numbers are as follows: `browse` (1), `oval` (14), `brush` (7), `pencil` (6), `bucket` (13), `poly[gon]` (18), `button` (2), `rect[angle]` (11), `curve` (15), `reg[ular] poly[gon]` (17), `eraser` (8), `round rect[angle]` (12), `field` (3), `select` (4), `lasso` (5), `spray [can]` (10), `line` (9), or `text` (16).

parameters.description: An expression referring to a tool either by name or number.

title: Click
summary: Clicks the mouse at the specified location using one or more optional modifier keys.

parameters.description: A point expression (like `10,20`) where the mouse should be clicked.
A list expression containing one or more modifier keys (`shiftKey`, `commandKey`, or `optionKey`)
The name of the file to be closed.

title: Convert
summary: Converts a date and/or time from one format to another.
description: When a value is specified (rather than a container), the conversion result is placed into it.

parameters.description: A time or date expression or a container of a such an expression to be converted.

One of `seconds` (an integer value equal to the number of seconds since the epoch, Jan. 1, 1970), `dateItems` (a comma-separated list of integers in the form `year, month, day, hour, minute, second, dayNumber`), `[ adjective ] date`, or `[ adjective ] time` where `adjective` is one of `long`, `short`, `abbreviated`, `abbrev` or `english`.
